question.body: Satellite cells would most often be associated with what structural type of neuron?

response.feedback: Incorrect. That is a functional classification that is the same as sensory neuron.
Incorrect. They are usually found in the central nervous system.
Incorrect. They are usually found in specialized sensory organs with their own support cells.
Correct. Unipolar sensory neuron cell bodies are surrounded by satellite cells in the ganglia while Schwann cells surround their dendrite/axon branches.
Incorrect. That is a functional classification and typically multipolar cell bodies found in central nervous system.

part.hint: Most of them surround the sensory cell body in the peripheral ganglia.
